answers.answer: HiThanks for writing to the forum!I would mainly ask you to get your blood pressure checked first both resting and after your exercise. Also check for diabetes.Hope this helps. It is difficult to comment beyond this at this stage. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: Hi,I have been running for over ten years - between three and five miles every evening. My health is fine otherwise, but lately, when I am resting after a run, I get an incredible pressure in my head and ears. It is not painful at all, just intense pressure and quite frightening. Any ideas what may be the cause or why the sudden occurence? I feel like my head will explode!
title: pressure in head and ears after running
